alert.note: Alert for Garden; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 7:13PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garden and southern Sheridan Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 612 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles south of Hay Springs to near Wild Horse Butte to 7 miles west of Redington. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Antioch, Billys Lake, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River, Miles Lake, Snow Lake, Wickson Lake, Diamond Lake, Lakeside, Herman Lake, Krause Lake, Tralnor Lake and Argo Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 37. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
